title: Emergency area
creator: Bruno St-Aubin
description: This atomic model periodically generates emergencies. It can also receive rejected emergencies to accumulate them and generate statistics.
subject: health
gis
simple
behavior: Every 24 hours, a random number of emergencies are generated by a geographic area. The number of emergencies is proportional to the population count of the area and uses a random factor for variance. Emergencies are first sent through the 1st of 3 ports. If it is rejected, then it is sent to the 2nd port and 3rd port.

state.description: This model tracks the number of dead inhabitants due to being rejected by all 3 ports.

field.name: dead
field.description: Number of deaths due to rejected emergencies.

field.name: area_id
field.description: The unique identifier of the area that generated the emergency.

field.name: port_i
field.description: The origin port through which this emergency was sent.

field.name: quantity
field.description: Number of persons for this emergency.
